file_content.text: Wait! Wait!
Jakarro still wishes to confront the men who betrayed him and left us for dead. As would I, actually.
What the droid said! We are coming with you!
Come on, then.
What's the matter, Arkous? Shuttle not ready yet?
We Revanites went through a great deal of trouble to reach this point in our campaign. For you to hamper our progress, it's... regrettable.
You, Lana... you were never anything more than pawns to us. Important pawns, but pawns all the same.
Tell me your plans.
If you speak another word, it had better involve what you and your Revanites are planning.
I demand to know what absurdity you and your cult have concocted. Speak.
This is the part where you give up and tell me everything, Arkous. Everything.
You're not even the twentieth person to underestimate me. I have the upper hand now, Sith Lord--so talk.
So, this is where I outline our grand design and then you decide whether or not to spare my life?
You wretched traitor.
Even among the most deceitful of the Dark Council, you stand out as a spectacular cretin, Arkous.
I'm appalled that a worm such as you was ever deemed my equal.
I don't even belong to the Empire and I can't wait to scrape you off my boot.
Pawns? Please. You wouldn't have lasted an hour as Minister of Intelligence.
Insults? It's no surprise that's all you're capable of.
We both know I'm more valuable than that.
I could join you....
Imagine it: the Emperor's Wrath leading the Order of Revan into a new era.
Why have just one Revanite in the Dark Council when you could have two?
Bet you need a lot of contracts carried out. Why not buy yourself an exclusively Revanite bounty hunter?
Your Order of Revan could use someone with my skill set. With my connections.
Oh, yes, but of course--you came all this way and ruined our efforts simply to sign up.
Enough! Darth Arkous will not cooperate! We kill him before he flees!
This grotesque alien beast does have it partly figured out. Indeed, I won't cooperate.
But I'm not fleeing. We will stand our ground and put an end to your perpetual interruption. Colonel?
If you could see what we were doing--what we want for the galaxy. But you can't see. You'll just have to die.
I don't think so.
Wait for us!
You're going to confront the men who betrayed us! We will spill their blood together!
Please try to headbutt them with your own skull this time!
Let's go.
Your plans are finished. The conspiracy ends now.
My, but we have a very high opinion of ourselves, don't we?
This project would have accelerated our plans considerably. Losing it is regrettable, but it will not stop us.
You've done a fair bit of damage, it's true. But the project isn't a total loss--after all, you've helpfully delivered yourselves for slaughter.
You've infiltrated the Republic and the Empire, raised an army of fanatics--why? What are you trying to achieve?
Why are you doing all this?
We have a plan. You're not a part of it. That's all that matters now.
Surrender. Now.
The time for threats is over. Abandon this madness, before it destroys you both.
It's not too late--not even for someone who's fallen as far as you. You can still be redeemed, if you will only release your hatred.
Jedi platitudes are meaningless. All that matters is the plan.
Colonel, you're not a fool--you can see your tactical situation just as well as me. Drop your weapon, and get your Sith friend to do the same.
Tactics mean nothing. The plan has been formed over countless decades. You cannot outmaneuver it.
You can't con a con artist. Your project is tanked. You've got nothing left. Just give it up.
I was planning on a little slaughter myself, actually. But I had a pair of lying traitors in mind.
You're the ones dying today.
Call us whatever you want. Words are meaningless. Nothing matters but the plan.
Is it part of your plan to be torn limb from limb?
You and your simple-minded beast will have the fight you came for. Colonel?
Let's get on with it.
This? This isn't madness. Madness would be quitting before the plan is complete.
We will never abandon the plan.
